result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ross Deakins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ross Deakins not in court - Authorization on file.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Ross Deakins.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA TenHaken. Called @ 3:31 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Dade who has gone over charges and penalties with the defendant, waives formal reading, and enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Matter set for status.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.Z. dob 5-12-1982. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2958 thru 22-2961

Defendant Ross A Deakins in court, in custody by video. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Minutes filed.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
